Subject: AIBT captured via ACARS
Source Text: Definition AIBT - Actual In-Block Time. This is the time that an aircraft arrives in-blocks.

Subject: AIBT captured via automated docking systems
Source Text: Origin and priority ACARS equipped aircraft or automated docking systems or ATC systems (e.g. A-SMGCS) or by manual input.

Subject: AIBT captured via ATC systems
Source Text: Origin and priority ACARS equipped aircraft or automated docking systems or ATC systems (e.g. A-SMGCS) or by manual input.

Subject: AIBT captured via manual input
Source Text: Origin and priority ACARS equipped aircraft or automated docking systems or ATC systems (e.g. A-SMGCS) or by manual input.

Subject: Airline/Handler records ATA
Source Text: (Equivalent to Airline/Handler ATA – Actual Time of Arrival, ACARS = IN)

Subject: ACARS status set to IN
Source Text: (Equivalent to Airline/Handler ATA – Actual Time of Arrival, ACARS = IN)

Subject: EIBT changes to AIBT
Source Text: Action on CDM EIBT changes to AIBT

Subject: Operational status changes to IN-BLOCK
Source Text: Operational Status (changes to) IN-BLOCK

Subject: TOBT and TTOT updated automatically
Source Text: Effect The occurrence of AIBT should trigger an update of downstream estimates: TOBT and TTOT are updated automatically

Subject: TOBT and TTOT inserted manually by AO/GH
Source Text: Effect The occurrence of AIBT should trigger an update of downstream estimates: TOBT and TTOT are updated automatically or inserted manually by the Aircraft Operator / Ground Handler

Subject: TOBT and TTOT updated in ACISP
Source Text: Operation (ACISP) TOBT and TTOT updated

Subject: Check AO/GH TOBT consistency with ATC Flight Plan
Source Text: Procedures To check whether the AO/GH TOBT is consistent with the ATC Flight Plan.

Subject: TTOT tolerance check performed
Source Text: A TTOT tolerance is respected before Network Operations is informed on updated TTOT.

Subject: Network Operations informed of TTOT change
Source Text: Network Operations is informed when the TTOT changes by more than the agreed TTOT tolerance.
